definition: according to one's capabilities/what sb is capable of
actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]
can/to be able to/might possibly/ability/(physics) energy
as far as one's capabilities extend (idiom); to the best of one's ability/within one's powers
each does his utmost (idiom)/from each according to his means

sentences.english: God loves you infinitely more than you can imagine.
sentences.chinese: 神的爱远超过你所能想像的。

sentences.english: I attacked again, this time with all the skill I could muster.
sentences.chinese: 我再次进攻，这一次用上了我所能集中的一切记忆。

sentences.english: As far as I can recollect, he wasn't home until 6 o'clock.
sentences.chinese: 就我所能回忆起来的，他到6点钟才回家。

sentences.english: That's the best trade-off I can think of, given an unexpected problem occurred.
sentences.chinese: 假如发生意外问题，这是我所能想到的最佳折中方式。

sentences.english: So we'll continue to do the best we can to interdict supplies.
sentences.chinese: 并且我们会继续尽我们所能来阻断毒品来源。

sentences.english: We both returned to work and began saving as much as we could.
sentences.chinese: 我们两个人都回去工作，开始尽我们所能地攒钱。

sentences.english: Now, as much as I can, I follow in his footsteps.
sentences.chinese: 现在，我尽我所能步其后尘而来。

sentences.english: You have more power than you can po ssibly imagine.
sentences.chinese: 你的能耐比你所能想象到的要大得多。

sentences.english: Their number incalculable; Thus also is the assembly of Bodhisattvas.
sentences.chinese: 非是算数之所能知，诸菩萨众，亦复如是。

sentences.english: And that would be the greatest gift I could offer.
sentences.chinese: 那将是我所能给予她们的最贵重的礼物。

sentences.english: I do my best to never, ever look like a crook.
sentences.chinese: 我尽一切所能让你根本看不出我是个骗子。

sentences.english: The EC only has nine people here and there is a limit to what we can do.
sentences.chinese: 欧共体只有九个人在这里工作，我们所能做的很有限。

sentences.english: Accept what you must, and change what you can.
sentences.chinese: 接收即定命运，改变你所能改变的。

sentences.english: Don’t become cynical, but verify everything you can. The lesson learned: make sure you know who it is you’re dealing with and what their motives may be.
sentences.chinese: 不要愤世嫉俗，但是近你所能核实一切。

sentences.english: Therefore, the other woodsman abandoned the cotton and carried the cloth on his back.
sentences.chinese: 发现布的樵夫则尽其所能背起布走。

sentences.english: And David said to Achish, Surely thou shalt know what thy servant can do.
sentences.chinese: 大卫对亚吉说，仆人所能作的事，王必知道。

definition: to compare/to draw a parallel/to match/analogy/metaphor/comparison
to hope to reach/to strive for
as far as one's capabilities extend (idiom); to the best of one's ability/within one's powers
as far as possible/to do one's utmost
